page.title: 01NEWHAVEN: GATEWAY TO EUROPE
page.content: Newhaven is a port on the South Coast at the mouth of the River Ouse. Behind it are the South Downs, at the foot of which nestles the charming Bishopstone village and to the east, stretches Seaford Bay. It lies on the shortest land and sea route between London and Paris via Dieppe. The population of 11,000 enjoy an environ- ment which offers fishing, sailing, sea bathing, country rambles, excellent shopping, day trips to France and provides employment in the harbour and industrial estates. It has 3 Primary and one Comprehensive school, 4 churches, a Health Centre, emergency services, job centre, library, numerous clubs and a lifeboat. Thus it is a good tourist centre and a pleasant place to live.
